gui

Class Questioner

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • javax.swing.JDialog
              • gui.Questioner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class Questioner
extends javax.swing.JDialog
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener

    Provides two ways for dealing with questions.

    The easy way to ask for a String, int or double is to use the static askString, askInt, askDouble or askChoice methods. These setup a Questioner and pose the question. When the ok-button is clicked, the result is evaluated and returned.

    You can also build a Questioner that contains more questions by creating a Questioner instance yourself and then add multiple questions. When ready adding questions, make the Questioner show itself.
    When the OK-button is applied, the window will disappear and you may retrieve the replies to the various questions with getString, getInt, getDouble or getChoice.
    Make sure to ask for the right type of reply value to avoid casting exceptions.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • askInt

        public static int askInt(java.lang.String question,
                         int value)
        Returns a int value in reply to a question. An input key is only accepted if the evaluation of the text would provide a legal int value, otherwise it is ignored.
        Parameters:
        question - The question String
        value - The initial answer value for this question
        Returns:
        the confirmed answer or, if not confirmed the initial answer

      • addChoice

        public void addChoice(java.lang.String question,
                      java.lang.Object[] choices)
        Adds a choice question to the questionlist. The choices are taken from a array of Objects, who's toString() method is invoked to get their String representation. Of the chosen item, the string representation is returned.
        Parameters:
        question - The question String
        choices - All the choices as an array of Objects.
        Throws:
        java.lang.AssertionError - Questioner may not be visible
        java.lang.AssertionError - question String can not be null
        java.lang.AssertionError - question String can not be empty
        java.lang.AssertionError - question is already present
        java.lang.AssertionError - choices should have at least one element
